text.more:
The map shows a subject categorization of 12.4 million publications from 2005-2021. Large nodes represent research desciplines. Thier colors represent broader research areas. For each of the large nodes, a network of sub-nodes, representing research specialties, is centralized to the parent node. When clicking on a specialty, a list of underlying topics is presented for the specialty. The classification has been obtained by algorithmic clustering based on direct citation relations between 17.1 million publications.
Clicking on a disciplines shows underlying specialties as well as sibling disciplines. Clicking on a specialty shows the 20 strongest connected specialties as well as the parent discipline.
